snippet: Andy Murray defeated Jo-Wilfried Tsonga to advance to the Wimbledon final, where he will try to become the first Briton to win the men’s singles title since Fred Perry in 1936.
abstract: Andy Murray advances to the Wimbledon final after defeating Jo-Wilfried Tsonga; he will face Roger Federer as he tries to become the first Briton to win the men’s singles title since Fred Perry in 1936; there have been scenes and sounds of patriotic delight from the crowd at Centre Court.
lead_paragraph: Andy Murray defeated Jo-Wilfried Tsonga to advance to the Wimbledon final, where he will try to become the first Briton to win the men’s singles title since Fred Perry in 1936.

headline.seo: Andy Murray Faces Stiffest Challenge Against Roger Federer in Wimbledon Final
headline.main: Men’s Title Comes Down to Federer vs. Britain
headline.print_headline: Men’s Title Comes Down to Federer vs. Britain
